Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tile

  • public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a tile for Carcassonne.
    Author:
    Ben Visness

    • Method Detail

      • getQuadrants

        public Quadrant[] getQuadrants()
        Gets the quadrants of this tile.
        Returns:
        An array of Quadrant objects.

      • getQuadrant

        public Quadrant getQuadrant(int side)
        Gets a specific quadrant of this tile. To avoid index errors, using the constants defined in this class is recommended.
        Parameters:
        side - The side of the tile to get the quadrant from.
        Returns:
        The Quadrant object for the given side of the tile.

      • hasQuadrantType

        public boolean hasQuadrantType(QuadrantType type)
        Checks whether this tile contains a quadrant of a given type.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of quadrant to check for.
        Returns:
        Whether the tile has a quadrant of the given type.

      • getQuadrantTypeOwner

        public Owner getQuadrantTypeOwner(QuadrantType type)
        Gets the owner of the given type of quadrant on the tile. (For example, the owner of the roads or cities on the tile.)
        Parameters:
        type - The type of quadrant to check.
        Returns:
        The owner of the given type of quadrant.

      • randomTile

        public static Tile randomTile()
        Constructs a new tile with all random quadrants.
        Returns:
        A randomized Tile object.

      • rotateLeft

        public void rotateLeft()
        Rotates the tile 90 degrees counterclockwise.

      • rotateRight

        public void rotateRight()
        Rotates the tile 90 degrees clockwise.

      • oppositeSide

        public static int oppositeSide(int side)
        Given a side index of this tile, gets the index of the opposite side.
        Parameters:
        side - The original side index.
        Returns:
        The index of the opposite side.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the tile.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
